senses.de: to communicate with someone, typically to maintain a relationship or check in on them
senses.ex: I’ll get in touch with you later to finalize the details.
senses.use: used to indicate establishing contact, especially by phone or email
cl: get in touch over the phone

Tips.title: Professional Context
Tips.description: Use 'get in touch' when initiating communication for professional or formal matters.
Tips.example: Our representative will get in touch with you to discuss further.

Tips.title: Casual Context
Tips.description: Use 'get in touch' to reconnect with friends or family members informally.
Tips.example: Let’s get in touch when you’re back in town.

Elementary.wordDefinition: ‘Get in touch’ is slightly more informal and implies initiating or continuing communication, whereas ‘contact’ is more formal and straightforward.
